title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: There are 3 phases: 20 minutes Mock-up lecture + 5min Q&A 20 minutes Research Presentation + 5min Q&A 1-hour Interview with questions There will be a month to wait before getting feedback
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Student Experience Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good and smooth, the interviewer asked me to relax and prepare myself before start. And even told me to let them know if I need extra time to answer the questions.
Interview Questions: What is the key strength that I have fits the role?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: the process is good and a bit long, with many behavior questions. and questions about culture. two people were interviewed. overall it is friendly. they wanna someone to start as soon as possible
Interview Questions: what is your biggest strength

title: Senior Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview takes about 30 minutes. I remember a question about Te Tiriti o Waitangi, Another question is please introduce your own strengths. The University of Auckland is a very good employer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Fair process in which I was kept well informed. The interviewers did their best to make me feel at ease, which I really appreciated. There were two rounds of interviews and I was ultimately successful in getting the job.
Interview Questions: What was one challenge you face in a previous role?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a speedy process. The recruitment officers all asked standard interview questions, along with interview questions specific to the field of study. They all had a professional manner.
Interview Questions: why did you apply for this position

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Started with a group interview, was somewhat of a weird scenario to try and make you uncomfortable. Group interview with 3 members of staff afterwards was focused on team skills and communication
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role

title: Research Operation Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very nice and lovely interviewers. Basic behavioural questions and some questions about motivations and salary. Interview in 40 mins with 2 people. 2 rounds interview. Phone interview first and then Zoom interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you leave your current job? 
What is your motivation in work?
Tell me a situation you made a mistake and what do you learn from it?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with more than ten candidates who were all very energetic and good at interpersonal skills. The process started with introductions and discussion of prior experience. Then about strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Client Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: It was a very formal interview and very professional. The interview was conducted by two interviewers, both with very good attitudes, and the questions asked were all job related， Patiently listened and carefully answered when asked questions
Interview Questions: Could you please give us a time out so tell us about a time when you encountered a difficult issue?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
this was for a contract role
Straight and structured process - Phone Screening, Panel Interview (Hiring Manager, Portfolio Lead, and Business Owner), and Programme Sponsor Interview .
Two rounds of negotiation , contract sign-off, and offer acceptance
Interview Questions:
1. Explain how will you manage difficult stakeholders 
2. How would you set-up programme governance 
3. What is the biggest risk to any programme from your experience.

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite long, it went on for a few months before they came back to me with an offer. This process included lots of different stages. Phone screening, online assessments. Assessment centre and interview, this included a group introduction and role play
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you received good customer service

title: Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland)
Interview Descriptions: Fast and efficient interview process with relevant to role with some questions on competency and outlining the main benefits of your skills to the role; also questions on ambition for the role
Interview Questions: Previous experience quesiton, self explanatory

title: Finance and Accounting Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: There are two questions. Each question gives 1 minute and 30 seconds to answer.  When one question finishes, then it moves to the next question automatically. You cannot go back to the previous question if you finish the question.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and why do you apply for the internship program?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in a nice new building, the interview itself was upfront about the job expectations, casual interview, talking about what the day would look like. The only problem is it became evident the job description was not the most accurate so I was shut down pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: It was a while ago so don't remember

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
An online meeting is scheduled by HR.

Then it is an online meeting with the development team and HR. You would be asked about conventional questions, such as previous experience, how you handle stress, how you work with co-workers, etc.
Interview Questions: What was the most recent technical challenge you faced?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Long process but was ok. Conducted over zoom during the 2020 pandemic. First was individual interviews, then group interviews. Two interviewers per person over a period of about two weeks. This meant that there were *a lot* of people applying.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest struggle in being an RA?

title: Graduate Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to complete a simple technical tests. Then I completed couple of phone interviews, where I was asked about myself and number of technical question on Jave programming language.
Interview Questions: Is Java pointer explicit or implicit?

title: Academic Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the UoA website. In 3 days of the vacancy closing I was notified that they wanted to interview me. 2 days after the interview I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with multiple priority deadlines?

title: Engineering TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. No formal interview just EOI email and CV. Was recommended this tutoring role by a supervisor and an offer was given shortly after.  Easiest method to obtain a TA role is through networking.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with X and Y?

title: Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, direct questions regarding HR. star technique questions. Overall good interview and professional environment. Easy process, direct questions regarding HR. star technique questions. Overall good interview and professional environment
Interview Questions: STAR technique situation based questions

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: It's basically just email conversations with your potential supervisor. If he/she agrees to take you as a student, you just need to follow the general application procedures of the University.
Interview Questions: What are your qualifications and experiences in the relevant field?

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview is about 30~40 minutes long and is mainly carried out by the interviewer's lead. 
The panel involves two, the executive and the manager.
Not enough questions asked for you to appeal yourself, so impress your employer with a resume.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work as a Technical Support?

title: Student Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Meet with interview panel who asked me to prepare a presentation and some open questions. Got feedback and reference check very quickly and offered a place. Very friendly interview panel.
Interview Questions: How did you coordinate with different stakeholders?

title: BI Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland)
Interview Descriptions:
- First had a Phone Interview with a AUT HR personal
- HR processed a Reference Check
- In person interview with the manager. Basic questions about my experience/seeing if you are a good fit for the team.
- Was given a offer which i accepted shortly after
Interview Questions: Questions relating to my background and experience in BI.

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview, where you arrived at the building, met the other people who were also applying for the job and the recruiters were very friendly and the interview process was not too much pressure.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions e.g. tell me about yourself

title: Resident Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Had 2 interviews- a group one with 9 other people, and an indivifual one for about 15-20 minutes. 
Group interview had questions like why should we choose you, what skills do you bring. It also had team activities to do with others.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you would be a good RA.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got interviewed by two people. There was a long queue, had to wait an hour from my scheduled time.  when we entered the small office they quickly asked me some behavioral questions
Interview Questions: What residence do you prefer

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions - why do you want the job, and what do you think you will learn from this? how flexible are you? Will you be on time? how busy are your classes? etc etc
Interview Questions: How flexible is your schedule?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland)
Interview Descriptions: Two people, one from upper management and my direct manager. Casual style of interview without technical questions. Basically to get an idea of character and more details about other jobs held elsewhere, in order to see if fit with the rest of the team would be good.
Interview Questions: Expand on experience at previous employer A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Auckland in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Walked into the room, sat down, drank some water, moved my legs, looked out the window, and then had a chat.  Then I slowly got out of my seat, stretched my legs, had a sip of water, and walked  out.
Interview Questions: What is your favourite ice cream.

title: International Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Nominated by faculty, and then confirmed by email. Very friendly environment to intake the interview. Very meaningful job to assist international students as to settle in a new country. Normally the interview hold in own student center in the faculty.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy, but I was called to a different campus than where classes were to be held. I sent my CV via email and they screened it out of maybe 40 odd applications. They said they would call me by the evening indicating whether I get the job or not, but I did not receive any response to my follow up emails or calls, which was a bit odd I guess.
Interview Questions: General questions were asked like what are your interests and why would you be interested in teaching. Are you okay checking exam papers if you're not selected for tutorship.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
There wasn't really an interview for my department (Science), you just had to have a high GPA - probably above 7.5 and someone gives you an email invitation to apply for the role

Next you're asked to input the hours you're free to work, which roles you'd prefer to work (Lab demonstrator, marker etc) and the papers you can teach.

That's about it, although we were told that getting this invitation doesn't guarantee a role - it really depends on the demand of each paper. After that it was silence on their end until I got the job.
Interview Questions:
What hours are you free to work?
Which papers are you able to teach?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The two head managers were extremely welcoming and friendly. We met in an interview room and talked about past experience that may be relevant to the role. We then proceeded to discuss the role itself and some of the common scenarios that pop up and how I would respond/react to these situations
Interview Questions: If you have an angry patron, how do you handle the situation?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel of 4 people.  Behavioural Questioning approach.  Each person on the panel had their list of questions to ask.  The interview was one hour long.  They wanted in-depth answers but there was insufficient time for great depth, considering the number of questions asked.
Interview Questions: How's your health?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted by 2 people, it lasted about 20 minutes long.  They asked pretty basic questions, such as tell us something about yourself, can you multi-task and can you handle angry customers.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer was angry?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: that is a quite easy interview. I applied online and wait two weeks to interview in person. ask me some technique questions and behavior questions. after another 1 week, I got the offer. I think it was a quite efficient recruiting process.
Interview Questions: some data structure questions like linked list, binary tree traversal, and reversion

title: Prospect Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
An online application was required. I waited several weeks and had assumed I was unsuccessful before being called for an interview. 

The panel was teo people who were professional and friendly. A positive experience.
Interview Questions: How would you research a prospect?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: At first I worked as an intern during my final semester at university. I was offered a paid position after completing the internship and expressing my interest in continuing the research. There was no formal interview process per se because my supervisor already knew how I worked and what I was capable of from the internship.
Interview Questions: How many hours a week are you avaliable

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I apply the job of undergraduate teaching assistant and I directly went to see our undergraduate teaching tutor in his office. He just asked me how long i wanted for the job and my former experience in teaching undergraduates.
Interview Questions: How many hours I want to have for the job

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, psychometric testing, group interview with team.   Unfortunately none of it was very well handled, and they sent me an email meant for another candidate.  The meet the team interview was really awkward.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current employer

title: Part I Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Auckland
Interview Descriptions: Online application, based on minimum GPA of about 6. Previous tutoring experience is essential, either at the University or outside of University. Applicants with higher grades generally favoured. Can apply for first or second semester, generally civil/engsci students preferred first semester and software/electrical/chemmat preferred second semester due to papers taught each semester
Interview Questions: Dynamics

title: Group Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview invite came in the form of email, which was uncommon, but it gave me the address and directions to the campus, and that was helpful. The interview itself was brief, about 25 minutes in total. I faced a panel of two (my managers) and they had a list of set questions they selected from.  The atmosphere was quite relaxed, and most questions were basic. The managers also gave me a detailed description of the job and the work environment. The whole experience was quite pleasant.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of how you handled a difficult situation.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. At discretion of line manager rather than hr. The usual strengths and weaknesses questions but more in line with experience. Phone interview proved difficult due to the time difference. Two interviewers, both researchers rather than a hr representative.
Interview Questions: Nothing outside of professional qualification questions. What techniques do you know. Papers published, in preparation, under review.

title: Applications Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview, 30% technical questions, 70% about my previous job
Interview Questions: Can't recall any

title: Sports Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was internally recruited into the roll from a previous sports roll within another division of the University. I was required to submit my CV to the new hiring director, take part in an initial 45 minute interview as well as submit a proposed business plan for activities for the roll for the coming year
Interview Questions: Because it was a new role reporting into a new director the most difficult questions were around how to make the sports role fit into the existing structure.

title: Limited Term Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Auckland (Auckland, Auckland) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: there were essentially no interviews required just that you have to be a student from the uni. Obviously your grades can't be too bad I suppose. I suppose you get to know most of the staff already by the time you are ready to do some tutoring.
Interview Questions: N/A
